text: running is a great way to stay in shape
if you haven't injured your knee it's a
great form of exercise the knee is very
complicated joint because you can't
strengthen the bone ligaments tendons
and cartilage in the knee but what you
can do is strengthen the muscles around
the knee to give us some more
stabilization Jason is going to
demonstrate four exercises for us today
to help strengthen the knee first
exercise is a squat now we want to make
sure that Jason does this correctly when
he does this he wants to have his feet
about shoulder width apart his shoulders
back and standing in a good posture his
first move is not having his knees go
forward but his first move will be his
hips going back what we want are his
hips going back hinging backwards
keeping that knee from going forward
over the toe pushing through his heels
so he engages those quads and his glutes
the second exercise is a split squat or
stationary lunge
jacy's gonna take a deep squat if that
right foot shoulders back good posture
drop his hips down push through that
right heel to come back up and Jayce is
very careful to keep that knee lined up
over an ankle so he doesn't lunge
forward he's really just dropping his
body straight down pushing through that
right heel so he engages his quads and
his clues
our third exercise is a single leg
balance with a diagonal reach we're
going to have Jason stay on his right
foot
he's going to do a single leg squat
keeping his back straight and kicking
that left leg back it's gonna reach
across with his left hand to engage
those inner thigh muscles to strengthen
and stabilize that those muscles around
the knee that helps stabilize the knee
as he lowers his body now we're also
going to have him reach across with the
other hand again keeping that quad tight
strengthening the lower leg and the knee
stabilizers our fourth exercise is a
single leg step up with an opposite leg
knee drive this is going to get close to
the box this is an eight inch box he's
going to do a step up and drive that
opposite leg up as he goes pushing
through that heel as he stands up
controls his body on the way down this
is a good quad exercise because on his
way up he uses that right quad to drive
himself up and he uses that quad also on
his controlling himself on the way down
you
